page.title: 19HISTORY OF MARKS TEY
page.content: The{de Mandeville}family were granted the land in this area and 39 other lordships by{William 1},for their services to him during the{Norman {Conquest}.{Geoffrey de Mandeville}in turn gave the land to the{de Merk} family ( "Held for one knight's fee"). It is from this family that{Marks Tey} gets its name,Tey coming from Saxon word for enclosure.Our school is situated in{Mandeville Road}.The A120 road through the village was once the Roman road _{Stane Street}and the A12 to London was the{Great Road}.Roman bracelets and other things have been found.The village is mentioned in the {Domesday Book}. {MARKS TEY CHURCH}The Church was built in Norman times.{Geoffrey de {Mandeville's}son gave money for the church to be built.They started to build it in 1100 and it was opened in
